revised_title: Mechanical Factors in Clupeid Lateral Line Sensory System
tldr: The authors investigated the excitation of lateral line sense organs in clupeid fish, specifically sprats, and found that the net movement of liquid inside the main lateral line canals is linearly related to the movement in the surrounding sea water. They discovered that the sprat lateral line sensory system can detect nearby fish in a school at distances of up to a few fish lengths, making it well-suited for sensory information in activities like schooling.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Fish Biology
